fields.title: comparing Gaussian mixtures and k-means
fields.pointers:
* Other clustering methods include:
**  [naive Bayes](naive_bayes) , a probabilistic model for discrete data
**  [spectral clustering](spectral_clustering) , for when the clusters don't have nice convex shapes
* The application of clustering to finding meaningful regions of images is called  [image segmentation](image_segmentation) .
fields.summary: Gaussian mixture models and K-means are two canonical approaches to clustering, i.e. dividing data points into meaningful groups. This concept node discusses the tradeoffs between them.
